title: Extraordinary reason a Gold Coast man masturbated near women at Broadwater Parklands
text:
An ice addict caught masturbating naked in public three times claimed he shouldn't have to wear clothes because women wear skimpy bikinis.

Cameron Francis, 34, has been spotted committing a spate of lewd acts in the Gold Coast since September 2018.

On Wednesday, he pleaded guilty in Southport Magistrates Court to over 20 charges, including three counts of wilful exposure, the Gold Coast Bulletin reported.

On Wednesday, he pleaded guilty in Southport Magistrates Court to over 20 charges, including three counts of wilful exposure (stock image)

The former boiler maker, who began using ice in 2016, admitted that he has a 'problem' after citizens found him mid-act and reported him to police.

He was discovered by a six-year-old girl pleasuring himself on a footpath in one of the incidents- with some occurring in broad day light.



Francis was fined $1000 and placed on 18 months probation for the other charges.

The acts were in breach of a suspended sentence implemented by the Supreme Court for drug trafficking in 2016.

Francis was first caught pleasuring himself in public on September 1 after approaching a women on a train, exposing his penis, then masturbating as he stood next to her.

When he was later caught by police at Robina train station, he told officers he had recently injected ice.

In August the following year he was found masturbating naked at Broadwater Parklands around 2pm.

A young girl stumbled across him before she quickly ran away.

Cameron Francis, 34, has been spotted committing a spate of lewd acts in the Gold Coast (pictured) since September 2018

Police prosecutor Sergeant Nilan Lynch said he was unapologetic when he was confronted by police a short time later.

'Francis stated he was naked and did not see any issue as females are allowed to wear skimpy swimming attire,' she said.

The following month a council worker found him masturbating naked on The Esplanade in Surfers Paradise at 5am.

Francis was dressed when police arrived but confessed to the indecent acts.

'He stated he has a problem and is trying to get help for it,' Sgt Lynch said.

The court also heard he had been recently caught carrying drugs, walking past a school with a knife and trying to break into a Hungry Jacks.

Magistrate Mark Howden described the public sex acts as 'concerning'.

'I can’t place him on probation although I do consider (the offences) to be of a concerning and persistent nature which has now been going on for a year,' he said.
